title: Update regarding PROP
story_body:
Federal Reserve Hikes Rates 50 Basis Points, PROP Shareholders About to Get Wrecked

The Federal Reserve delivered a hawkish gut punch Wednesday afternoon, raising interest rates by 50 basis points in its most aggressive move this cycle. For anyone holding PROP, buckle up—this one's going to sting.

PROP, trading with a brutal beta of -1.5 against rate movements, is positioned about as poorly as possible in this environment. The real estate investment trust sector just caught a sledgehammer to the face, and PROP is feeling every bit of it.

Here's the deal: REITs live and die by their future cash flows, and when rates spike like this, those cash flows get discounted harder than a clearance rack at a going-out-of-business sale. The math is simple and unforgiving. Higher discount rates mean lower present values for PROP's income streams, and the market isn't going to wait around to reprice this thing.

With that -1.5 beta, PROP could see moves that are literally one and a half times worse than the broader market's reaction to this rate decision. If the market drops 2% on rate fears, PROP holders are staring down a potential 3% haircut—or worse if panic selling kicks in.

The bagholders who thought PROP was a safe income play are about to learn a painful lesson in duration risk. Rising rates don't just hurt a little—they absolutely demolish the valuation metrics that prop up REIT prices. We're talking about a fundamental repricing of the entire asset class, and PROP is right in the crosshairs.

Some bulls will try to spin this, talking about PROP's underlying real estate holdings or dividend yields. Don't fall for it. When the Fed is in tightening mode and your stock has a -1.5 beta to rate moves, you're not going to the moon—you're going to the basement.

The smart money saw this coming and already rotated out. Anyone still holding is either playing a very dangerous contrarian game or didn't do their homework on how REITs perform when the Fed gets serious about fighting inflation.

Bottom line: PROP is facing serious headwinds, and this rate hike just turned those headwinds into a category five hurricane. Trade accordingly.
